gameinterfaces

Interface Game


  • public interface Game
    A class that implements this interface should have the following attributes:
    • player: Player
    • dungeon: Room[]
    The implementing class should only have the following constructor: public Game(): 1. Read player information from "PlayerInfo.txt". This file should contain five lines, each containing one of the following value: player name, player description, hit points, damage, and heal amount. Use the info to constructor this.player. Handle IOException properly. 2. Declare this.dungeon as an array of 3 rooms. 3. Create monster1 with name="Orc", description="covered with green blood", hitPoints=20, damage=5, enrageThreshold=0. 4. Create room1 with monster1 and description="a room with an unbearable smell". 5. Create monster2 with name="Skeleton", description="funny how it moves", hitPoints=40, damage=10, enrageThreshold=10. 6. Create room2 with monster2 and description="dark and cold". 7. Create monster3 with name="Fire dragon", description="spout fire with each breath", hitPoints=100, damage=20, enrangeThreshold=40. 8. Create a TreasureRoom room3 with monster3 and description="a giant hall with something shiny on the other end", and treasure="a large pile of gold". 9. Add room1, room2, and room3 to this.dungeon room should be initialized to null There should be a static main method. It creates a Game object and invokes its play() method.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void play()
      This method let this.player enter each room in order and battle against monsters.

    • Method Detail

      • play

        void play()
        This method let this.player enter each room in order and battle against monsters. This method also creates a text file "GameLog.txt" containing: 1. Player's name 2. For each room player entered, record whether player complete the room or died at that room. 3. Write "THE END" at the end of the file.
